description: Audsley lists this stop with the following description: A metal labial stop, of 4 ft. pitch, voiced to yield a bright and piercing flute-tone. It is valuable, in the absence of a Compensating Mixture, for imparting brightness to the Pedal Organ. A Scharfflöte, 4 ft., exists in the Pedal of the Organ in the Cathedral of Merseburg. Wedgwood says only �a Flute of bright incisive tone�, and Adlung calls it �keenly voiced�.
